item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Hints at New Thoma "Traveler's Tales" Story
item.description:
Summary

  • Genshin Impact leaks are hinting at a new "Traveler's Tales" story for Thoma coming with the launch of the Version 5.7 update.
  • The story event will reportedly introduce Thoma's mother as a member of the Knights of Favonius, currently adventuring with Grand Master Varka's squad.
  • The Knights of Favonius have been teased as a major faction involved with the story of the Nod-Krai region, launching later this year.

A Genshin Impact leak is hinting at new story content coming with Genshin Impact 's Version 5.7 update, teasing more backstory to come for fan-favorite Inazuma character Thoma. The HoYoverse RPG has featured a wide variety of different ways to present the story of its characters, between both the main story and side quests focused around particular cast members. "Character Quests" focus on the stories of individual roster members, while HoYoverse has also featured "Hangout" events for several of its four-star units. Now, one of Inazuma's most popular characters is getting new story content soon.

Genshin Impact 's island region of Inazuma has served as one of the game's most popular locales since its initial debut in Version 2.0. Inazuma was the first fully new region added to the game following its release in late 2020, featuring a wide array of unique locations between the towering Tenshukaku and the picturesque Watatsumi Island. The region has also boasted some of Genshin Impact 's most beloved characters, including fan-favorite cast members like Kamisato Ayaka, Raiden Shogun, and Sangonomiya Kokomi. New information is now hinting at a brand-new event for one of Inazuma's playable characters.

Genshin Impact Leak Teases New Thoma Story Content

New leaks shared by Genshin Impact leakers MadCroiX and spletnik_fatui are hinting at some new backstory elements for Thoma in Version 5.7. According to the leak, Genshin Impact 's new story content will introduce Thoma's mother, Ulrika, as a member of the Knights of Favonius, dispatched to Nod-Krai as part of Varka's platoon. The leak also hints at Ulrika's personality, suggesting she is free-spirited and kind while also confirming she is Kaeya's senior within the Knights' hierarchy. The new Traveler's Tales story will arrive with Version 5.7, set to launch on June 18.

The new backstory surrounding Thoma and his mother could lend several hints about new content coming with Genshin Impact 's next region. Varka's squad within the Knights of Favonius has been teased as one of the major factions involved with the story of the Nod-Krai region, launching with Version 6.0 later this summer. HoYoverse has already teased several other major groups involved with Nod-Krai's story, including the Hexenzirkel, Fatui, and the Treasure Hoarders among others.

Alongside Thoma's new story content, Version 5.7 is expected to bring plenty to Genshin Impact as the game winds down its Natlan cycle. HoYoverse has already confirmed two new characters launching during the RPG's next update, adding Skirk as a new five-star character and Dahlia as a four-star unit. Genshin Impact is also heavily rumored to be adding a new endgame game mode, with recent leaks teasing "Tumult Subduer" as a new combat-based challenge requiring 3 different teams. Between new characters, new story content, and the next region, Genshin Impact has lots in store for fans soon.

item.title: First-Party Nintendo Games Safe from Switch 2 Game Key-Cards
item.description:
Summary

  • Nintendo Switch 2's first-party games will not use the Game Key-Card feature, ensuring full game data on physical cartridges.
  • Third party games have the option to use Game Key-Cards.
  • Game Key-Cards give users access to a digital download of the game.

Nintendo Switch 2 's first-party games will not be utilizing the controversial Game Key-Card feature that has drawn criticism from fans who prefer to possess physical copies of games. That means game cartridges starring classic characters like Mario and Link on Nintendo Switch 2 will still contain the full version of their games even if plenty of third-party games don't.

After months of rumors, the Nintendo Direct presentation in early April confirmed a lot of features and specs for the Switch 2. The successor to the original Switch launches on June 5, and it comes with a wide array of upgrades over its predecessor, including ten times the graphical processing power and intriguing Joy-Con features like magnetic attachments to the console and mouse capabilities.

But one far less popular announcement affects the game's cartridges, as Nintendo's Game Key-Card feature means some seemingly physical games will contain no game data at all, instead providing players with a license that will allow them to download games directly to their devices. Responding to an inquiry from Nintendo Life, the company has announced that while this feature will be available to third-party developers, Nintendo currently has no plans to utilize it for games developed under the first-party brand. There is no clarification on whether that treatment will extend to Nintendo-published games, but other statements from company officials point to its physical copies still containing game data, at least for the immediate future.

Nintendo is Keeping First-Party-Developed Games Free of Game-Keys

The fan backlash to the announcement of Game-Key Cards has prompted Nintendo of America president Doug Bowser to provide some explanations. Earlier this week, Bowser reiterated Nintendo's commitment to making physical games available, but he also noted that the Switch 2's 64GB cartridges do not provide enough storage space to house some games in their entirety. In order to provide Switch 2 players with the biggest game catalog possible, Game Key-Cards provide a way for third-party publishers and developers to offer games with larger file sizes on the Switch 2, which opens up possibilities that the cartridges' hardware couldn't provide otherwise.

While several third-party companies are taking advantage of this feature, some others are opting to keep their games fully available in a physical format on the new console. CD Projekt Red's Jan Rosner noted earlier in May that Cyberpunk 2077 will pass on the Game Key option for its Switch 2 release, stating that offering a full physical release is "the right thing to do."

item.title: 'Incredible' Grand Theft Auto 6 Fans Point Out Impressive Trailer 2 Detail
item.description:
Summary

  • Grand Theft Auto 6 Trailer 2 continues to impress fans.
  • Fans point out the incredible amount of detail that has gone into the power lines in Grand Theft Auto 6.
  • Take-Two CEO says Grand Theft Auto 6 began development "in earnest" in 2020.

It's been almost two weeks since developer and publisher Rockstar Games released Grand Theft Auto 6 Trailer 2, and fans are still being blown away by some incredibly impressive visual details. Grand Theft Auto 6 is set to launch on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S on May 26, 2026, and looks set to push all three consoles to the absolute limit.

Fans of the critically acclaimed Grand Theft Auto series have had a stressful few years. After a monumental leak occurred in 2022, revealing early alpha footage from Grand Theft Auto 6 , fans were eager to see more from the title in an official capacity. Rockstar addressed the unfortunate leak soon after, but refused to divulge any further information on the title until December 2023, when it finally revealed Grand Theft Auto 6 to the world with an internet-breaking trailer. Fans were then left in the dark for well over 500 days, with no word on the game from Rockstar Games. Then, less than two weeks ago, the studio shocked the world with a brand-new GTA 6 trailer, tons of details, and over 70 new screenshots.

GTA 6 Fans Blown Away by Trailer 2 Details

The record-breaking second trailer for Grand Theft Auto 6 has already racked up more than 475 million views across all social media platforms, so it's no surprise that fans are still picking out some of its most impressive details. In a new post on Reddit, user BoogaSnu pointed out that the power lines featured in Trailer 2 are incredibly detailed, with every cable and transformer rendered to the highest detail. The original poster called it "incredible," while others called it "impressive" and an "awesome detail." Some are even speculating that crashing into the poles in-game may cause power outages around Vice City.

The last Rockstar Games title to release was 2018's Red Dead Redemption 2 , which fans have already been comparing to Grand Theft Auto 6 . While 2013's Grand Theft Auto 5 was already massively impressive, especially for the PS3 and Xbox 360 era, Red Dead Redemption 2 blew many other games out of the water when it came to graphic fidelity. Many questioned whether or not Rockstar could top the visuals of Red Dead Redemption 2 , but with Trailer 2 showcasing in-engine footage and gameplay, there's no denying that Grand Theft Auto 6 is likely going to become the pinnacle of graphic fidelity.

While Rockstar revealed a ton of new information surrounding the title with the release of Trailer 2, the studio's parent company, Take-Two Interactive, recently touched upon the title during a new quarterly earnings call. According to the company's CEO, Strauss Zelnick, Grand Theft Auto 6 began development "in earnest" in 2020. Given the CEO's phrasing, it's speculated that pre-production on the title likely began shortly after the launch of Red Dead Redemption 2 in 2018. If the theory is correct, Grand Theft Auto 6 will have been in development for seven or eight years by the time 2026 rolls around.

item.title: Roblox: Baddies Codes (May 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Baddies Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Baddies
  • How to Get More Baddies Codes

Baddies is an open-world RPG where you can do literally anything. If you want to be a blogger, you're welcome to do so, or if you want to be a bad guy, that's also easy, but the only thing that can stop you is a lack of cash.

But like most other Roblox games, in Baddies you can redeem codes to make your life easier. By doing so, you'll get a bunch of freebies, including cash, outfits, and other accessories that will help you become more popular and cooler.

Updated May 17, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There's only one active code for Baddies right now. You can redeem it to unlock a Treasure Chest Purse Skin, which adds a unique cosmetic touch to your collection. While it's not a big list, it's still worth grabbing before it disappears. Make sure to check back soon in case any new codes get added.

All Baddies Codes

Working Baddies Codes

  • Baddies - Redeem this code to get Treasure Chest Purse Skin.

Expired Baddies Codes

There are currently no expired Baddies codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

Redeeming Baddies codes is one of the easiest ways to quickly gain success in the game. In just a few seconds, you'll get a bunch of freebies and be able to dictate the rules to those who used to despise you, so hurry up.

How to Redeem Codes for Baddies

Redeeming Baddies codes is as easy as in most other Roblox experiences and will take you a few clicks. If you haven't redeemed codes before, or don't understand how to do it specifically in Baddies , here's a detailed guide to help you figure it out:

  • Launch Baddies .
  • Pay attention to the upper right corner of the screen. There will be several buttons arranged in a row. Among them, interact with the third one, which says Codes.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a yellow Claim Reward button. Now, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned working codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the yellow Claim Reward button to submit your reward request.

If everything went well, a notification will appear above the redemption menu with a list of rewards received. If it didn't work, make sure you didn't make any mistakes when entering the code manually, or insert an extra space when copy-pasting it.

How to Get More Baddies Codes

If the rewards you have received are not enough and you want to get more Baddies codes, you can find them on the official social networks of the game. By attentively monitoring the latest updates and news, you may be lucky enough to find new Roblox codes:

  • Official Baddies Roblox group.
  • Official Baddies Discord server.
  • Official Baddies X account.

item.title: Warframe Codes (May 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Warframe Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Warframe
  • Warframe Tips and Tricks
  • The Best Shooting Games Like Warframe
  • About the Warframe Developers

Warframe is a free-to-play sci-fi action game. It actually feels like the developers worked really hard on the game, as they have thought of many features, including customization items. Below are plenty of Warframe codes for freebies as Glyphs skins and others.

Updated May 17, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: You can redeem a wide range of Warframe glyph codes right now, along with a decoration from the active promo. These codes give you access to custom glyphs from creators and community members. More codes may drop over time, so it’s worth checking back later.

Warframe Codes

Below, fans will find all the codes for Warframe, including a lot of Glyph codes. In the game, Glyphs are special images that players can use to personalize their profile or to distribute in the game. Glyphs can be placed on certain surfaces in the game, such as the walls of a player's base, or used as a profile picture.

How to Redeem Codes in Warframe

The process of redeeming codes is not as easy as one would expect since it is different from most other games. Therefore, if players have any difficulties, the step-by-step instructions below will help them:

  • First, visit the official promo code page on the Warframe website.
  • Then, players need to log in to their Warframe account.
  • Afterward, they should enter or copy the above-mentioned code in the Promo Code field.
  • To redeem the code, click the Submit Code button.

Warframe Tips and Tricks

  • Platinum Strategy: Invest the initial 50 platinum wisely, focusing on weapon and Warframe slots for efficient gear management.
  • Mastery Rank: Increase Mastery Rank by leveling gear and completing Mastery Tests.
  • Star Chart Priority: Systematically conquer Star Chart missions before venturing into open-world areas for better rewards later on.
  • Trading Tactics: Engage in trading when a platinum discount is available, and rely on Warframe Market for fair transactions, avoiding trade chat as a beginner.
  • Nightwave Rewards: Participate in Nightwave challenges for valuable items and rank advancement.
  • Syndicate Support: Join syndicates for passive reputation gains and rewards.
  • Endo Management: Spend Endo wisely, choosing essential mods over others.
  • Premium Assistance: Consider premium boosts for faster progression, especially if time is limited.

The Best Shooting Games Like Warframe

Shooters have proven to be very diverse, from fantasy to classics like Counter-Strike , for example. For those looking to expand their gaming experience, this article will provide five enjoyable and addictive shooters like Warframe .

  • Paladins
  • Payday 2
  • Warface
  • Apex Legends
  • Overwatch 2

About the Warframe Developers

Warframe was created by the developers from Digital Extremes. This Canadian team has been making games since 1993 and has more than 200 workers. Here are some of their titles:

  • Unreal Tournament
  • Epic Pinball
  • Dark Sector
  • The Darkness II
  • Soulframe
